definition: to follow old patterns/to imitate existing models/to continue along the same lines
to attack/to inherit/classifier for suits (esp. of funeral robes)

sentences.english: They have a great contempt for conventionality.
They were bound up in fetters of conventionalism.
sentences.chinese: 他们被因袭主义的枷锁所束缚。

sentences.english: But this is only a conventional literary conceit.
sentences.chinese: 但是这只是一种因袭的文人自负而已。

sentences.english: This new dress is the stylized design of the 18th century.
sentences.chinese: 这套新款服装因袭了18世纪的款式。

sentences.english: So perhaps this is just keeping with tradition.
sentences.chinese: 这或许是因袭他们过去的传统吧。

sentences.english: In the writing of old prose he approved of the naturalness and fluency and disapproved of the imitation.
sentences.chinese: 在古文写作上强调文从字顺，反对因袭模仿。

definition: to continue the same old routine/to carry on just as before/to procrastinate
(idiom) to continue in the same old rut/diehard conservative attitudes
to hold tight/to cling to/to adhere/stubborn/to detain sb as prisoner
old system/weights and measures of former times
stick-in-the-mud/to stick to old ways/stubbornly conservative
to add parallels and interpretations (to a story etc)/to develop and embellish/to interpret (often in a strained manner)
